column4: hey, looks like I deleted my home directory and all my settings files for gnome.
How do I create a new gnome profile
Can anyone tell me how to create a new Gnome profile after I accidentally killed my home directory?
Hello!! Can anyone tell me how to create a new Gnome profile after I accidentally killed my home directory?
Usually just logging in again will do it (after copying anything from /etc/skel to your new home)
well, I will enter gnome from the login screen, but then all I get is a screen with my mouse pointer on it
no menu bars or anything
so I was thinking I probably killed all my gnome settings in the home directory.
Did you lose your actual home directory?
well, no. but everything in it is gone.
including hidden stuff?
yeah. I just did an "ls -a" though, and it looks like I have some of my settings files back. Still, gnome won't fully load.

Hmmm. Are you really concerned with your settings (ie. customised to the extreme like me) because maybe deleting them and letting them be remade might work. However, it may not be a settings problem, it may be a  network/authentication one
well, I'm not too worried about my settings, and it does look like many of the settings files were recreated when I attempted to log in again.
I have encountered this before, but I forgot how I solved it. I think it was a permission thing
so maybe it's not the fact that I killed my files, it's something else. I'm not sure what to do. Would an apt-get of gnome be an idea?
I think removing your user and adding it again might work better as I think there are important files in your home for logging you into X
ok. do you know the command? is it just a 'useradd'?
either that or adduser :)
yeah, isn't there a difference - like you can add a user but it won't create a home dir, or something like that? Various adduser options?
I honestly don't know (adduser seems fine whenever I use it)
cool. I'll look at the man page and try that.
add an "&" after it (so "firefox &")
